intro: Lisianthius brevifolius, commonly known as the short-leaved lisianthium, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its small, white to yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited range, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
